googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Minnesota driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter your Minnesota driver’s license or state ID number.  If you don't have one, provide the last 4 digits of your social security number. If you don't have any of these numbers, write “NONE” here.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Minnesota voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Secretary of State  
60 Empire Drive, Suite 100  
St. Paul, MN 55103‐1855
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: Most Minnesota voters do not need to show ID. First time Minnesota voters should be prepared to show ID.  Acceptable forms of ID include A include a non-expired photo ID, such as a driver license from any state, a US passport, a government ID, a military ID, a tribal ID, or a student ID from an accredited college or university; OR a current utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck, or other government document that shows your name and Minnesota address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license. If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected. Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: If you have a Minnesota driver's license, state ID card, or the last 4 numbers of your social security -- and an email address -- you can register to vote online. If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Minnesota voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Minnesota you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Minnesota for 20 days before the next election
  * maintain residence at the address given on the registration form
  * be at least 18 years old on Election Day
  * if previously convicted of a felony, have completed or been discharged from your sentence
  * not be under a courtordered guardianship in which the right to vote has been revoked
  * not be found by a court to be legally incompetent to vote
